title: WCAS CHEM 305-0-01 Chemistry of Life Processes
class_attributes:
Attendance at 1st class mandatory

Auditing not permitted

Prerequisites apply, see description

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: In this topics class we will cover the chemistry involved in various biological processes. Topics may include intracellular signaling and signaling pathways, ligand-receptor interactions, post-translational modifications, molecular probe design for biological targets, glycobiology, molecular imaging techniques and translation science. In the second half of the class, students will learn how to prepare, present and evaluate NIH R01 style research proposals. Prerequisite: Completion of Chemistry 210-3 and 230-3; or 212-2 and 232-2 and 1 biochemistry course; or consent of instructor.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Prerequisite: Completion of Chemistry 210-3 and 230-3; or 212-2 and 232-2 and 1 biochemistry course; or consent of instructor.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Introduction to Bioorganic Chemistry and Chemical Biology, Van Vranken and Weiss, 1st Edition, Garland Science

subject: CHEM
